s0433.chinese: 十六年，王絀翟后，翟人來誅，殺譚伯。
s0433.literal: Sixteenth year, the king deposed the Di queen, the Di people came to attack, killed Tan Bo.
s0433.idiomatic: Sixteenth year, the king deposed the Di queen, the Di people came to attack, killed Tan Bo.

s0434.literal: Fu Chen said: 'I have advised many times and you did not follow.
s0434.idiomatic: Fu Chen said: 'I have advised many times and you did not follow.

s0435.chinese: 如是不出，王以我為懟乎？」
s0435.literal: If I do not leave now, will the king consider me resentful?'
s0435.idiomatic: If I do not leave now, will the king consider me resentful?'

s0437.chinese: 初，惠后欲立王子帶，故以黨開翟人，翟人遂入周。
s0437.literal: At first, Hui Hou wished to establish Prince Dai, therefore through her faction she opened the way for the Di people, the Di people thus entered Zhou.
s0437.idiomatic: At first, Hui Hou wished to establish Prince Dai, therefore through her faction she opened the way for the Di people, the Di people thus entered Zhou.

s0438.chinese: 襄王出奔鄭，鄭居王于汜。
s0438.literal: King Xiang fled to Zheng, Zheng housed the king at Si.
s0438.idiomatic: King Xiang fled to Zheng, Zheng housed the king at Si.

s0439.chinese: 子帶立為王，取襄王所絀翟后與居溫。
s0439.literal: Zi Dai established himself as king, took the Di queen whom King Xiang had deposed and lived with her at Wen.
s0439.idiomatic: Zi Dai established himself as king, took the Di queen whom King Xiang had deposed and lived with her at Wen.

s0440.chinese: 十七年，襄王告急于晉，晉文公納王而誅叔帶。
s0440.literal: Seventeenth year, King Xiang appealed urgently to Jin, Duke Wen of Jin received the king and executed Shu Dai.
s0440.idiomatic: Seventeenth year, King Xiang appealed urgently to Jin, Duke Wen of Jin received the king and executed Shu Dai.

s0441.chinese: 襄王乃賜晉文公珪鬯弓矢，為伯，以河內地與晉。
s0441.literal: King Xiang then granted Duke Wen of Jin the jade tablet, sacrificial wine, bow and arrows, made him hegemon, and gave the land within the Yellow River to Jin.
s0441.idiomatic: King Xiang then granted Duke Wen of Jin the jade tablet, sacrificial wine, bow and arrows, made him hegemon, and gave the land within the Yellow River to Jin.

s0442.chinese: 二十年，晉文公召襄王，襄王會之河陽、踐土，諸侯畢朝，書諱曰「天王狩于河陽」。
s0442.literal: Twentieth year, Duke Wen of Jin summoned King Xiang, King Xiang met him at Heyang and Jiantu, all the feudal lords attended court, the record euphemistically says 'The Heavenly King hunted at Heyang.'
s0442.idiomatic: Twentieth year, Duke Wen of Jin summoned King Xiang, King Xiang met him at Heyang and Jiantu, all the feudal lords attended court, the record euphemistically says 'The Heavenly King hunted at Heyang.'

s0443.literal: Twenty-fourth year, Duke Wen of Jin died.
s0443.idiomatic: Twenty-fourth year, Duke Wen of Jin died.

s0444.literal: Thirty-first year, Duke Mu of Qin died.
s0444.idiomatic: Thirty-first year, Duke Mu of Qin died.

s0445.chinese: 三十二年，襄王崩，子頃王壬臣立。
s0445.literal: Thirty-second year, King Xiang died, his son King Qing Renchen ascended.
s0445.idiomatic: Thirty-second year, King Xiang died, his son King Qing Renchen ascended.

s0446.chinese: 頃王六年，崩，子匡王班立。
s0446.literal: King Qing's sixth year, he died, his son King Kuang Ban ascended.
s0446.idiomatic: King Qing's sixth year, he died, his son King Kuang Ban ascended.

s0447.chinese: 匡王六年，崩，弟瑜立，是為定王。
s0447.literal: King Kuang's sixth year, he died, his younger brother Yu ascended, this was King Ding.
s0447.idiomatic: King Kuang's sixth year, he died, his younger brother Yu ascended, this was King Ding.

s0448.chinese: 定王元年，楚莊王伐陸渾之戎，次洛，使人問九鼎。
s0448.literal: King Ding's first year, King Zhuang of Chu attacked the Rong of Luhun, camped at Luo, sent someone to inquire about the Nine Tripods.
s0448.idiomatic: King Ding's first year, King Zhuang of Chu attacked the Rong of Luhun, camped at Luo, sent someone to inquire about the Nine Tripods.

s0449.chinese: 王使王孫滿應設以辭，楚兵乃去。
s0449.literal: The king sent Wangsun Man to respond with elaborate words, the Chu army then departed.
s0449.idiomatic: The king sent Wangsun Man to respond with elaborate words, the Chu army then departed.

s0450.chinese: 十年，楚莊王圍鄭，鄭伯降，已而復之。
s0450.literal: Tenth year, King Zhuang of Chu besieged Zheng, the Lord of Zheng surrendered, afterward he released him.
s0450.idiomatic: Tenth year, King Zhuang of Chu besieged Zheng, the Lord of Zheng surrendered, afterward he released him.

s0451.literal: Sixteenth year, King Zhuang of Chu died.
s0451.idiomatic: Sixteenth year, King Zhuang of Chu died.

s0452.chinese: 二十一年，定王崩，子簡王夷立。
s0452.literal: Twenty-first year, King Ding died, his son King Jian Yi ascended.
s0452.idiomatic: Twenty-first year, King Ding died, his son King Jian Yi ascended.
